p.s: The novel The Hate U Give, written by Angie Thomas and published by Cornelsen in 2019, is about a teenage girlsgirl who lost her friend to a shooting and tries to deal with it.
In chapter 24 p. 328-332 it is about the protest Starr takes place in.
Starr arrives at the street where Khalil got shot.
It is the first time she is there after the shooting and that is why she gets flashbacks.
Ms. Ofrah recognises Starr and walks up to her.
She encourages Starr to speak up against the police.
Starr climbs on the patrol car and Ms. Ofrah passes her the bullhorn.
First Starr does not know what to say, but after a few encouraging words from the audience Starr speaks up.
She says that she is the witness and that it is not right what happened.
She turns to the cops and says that it does not really matter how Khalil died, but that he lived.
